line_2: Whyles, owre the wee bit cup an' platie,

line_1: And I that have been kept for being pretty,
line_2: Suppos'd a Beau, through the well govern'd City;

line_1: And I that have been kept for being pretty,
line_2: You wh—res may be thought Chast,You Criticks witty

line_1: The Creature has Sense, and, in my Eyes, is pretty,
line_2: With Talents to make a good Man in the City;
So sparkling, so merry, and witty.

line_1: And then so snug, so mighty pretty,
line_2: To have an house so near the city!

line_1: And conscious it neither is witty or pretty,
line_2: Conceals her true name, and ascribes it to Betty.

line_1: Cries PEGGY, "This Place is enchantingly pretty;
line_2: " We never can see such a Thing in the City:

line_1: One who's not Proud, if you tell her she's Pretty;
line_2: Give me the Girl that's good natur'd and Witty,
